meanings.definition: The beliefs, practices, or principles associated with the priesthood.
meanings.sent1: The sacerdotalisms of the church guide the priests in their duties.
meanings.sent2: The sacerdotalisms of the religion dictate the rituals performed by the clergy.
meanings.sent3: The sacerdotalisms of the temple were so strict that even the smallest mistake was frowned upon.
meanings.sent4: In the ancient order, the sacerdotalisms were upheld with unwavering devotion.
meanings.sent5: The sacerdotalisms of the monastery were deeply ingrained in the daily lives of the monks.

meanings.definition: The system or institution of the priesthood.
meanings.sent1: Within the sacerdotalisms of the church, each priest has specific duties.
meanings.sent2: The sacerdotalisms of the religion have been passed down for generations.
meanings.sent3: The sacerdotalisms of the priesthood ensure order and structure within the community.
meanings.sent4: The sacerdotalisms of the ancient civilization were revered by all.
meanings.sent5: The sacerdotalisms of the monastery provided a sense of purpose to the monks.

meanings.definition: The state or quality of being sacerdotal.
meanings.sent1: His actions reflected the sacerdotalisms of his faith.
meanings.sent2: The sacerdotalisms of the church were evident in every ceremony.
meanings.sent3: She approached her duties with the utmost sacerdotalisms.
meanings.sent4: The sacerdotalisms of the priesthood were deeply respected by the community.
meanings.sent5: The sacerdotalisms of the monastery brought a sense of peace to all who visited.
